entry.title: Polkadot Pairs With Beatport To Bring Electronic Music On Chain
entry.summary:
Polkadot is one blockchain that we haven‚Äôt recently associated in the entertainment and sports coverage here at Bitcoinist. Blockchains like Polygon, Solana, Tezos and Avalanche (among others) have taken a very culture or creative-first approach in a variety of ways, but Polkadot ‚Äì despite being a consistent top 20 player ‚Äì has rarely been in that dialogue recently.
That tide could be in the midst of turning as the chain has announced a new partnership with electronic music powerhouse Beatport this week.
The two parties will be collaborating on a new, on-chain electronic music platform. Let‚Äôs take a look at the details we know thus far.
Beatport Meets Polkadot Beatport and Polkadot are launching Beatport.io, which is currently a landing page directing to a waiting list. As the platf‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto Not It, Regulators Denied Signature Bank Was Targeted For Ties With Digital Assets
entry.summary:
After being shut down by U.S. regulators on Sunday, crypto-friendly Signature Bank director and former Congressman Barney Frank claimed they had ‚Äúno indication of problems.‚Äù They suggested the bank‚Äôs closure was a ‚Äústrong anti-crypto message‚Äù from regulators.¬†
Following the Signature director‚Äôs comments, the Department of Financial Services (DFS) claimed that the bank‚Äôs resolution ‚Äúhad nothing to do with crypto,‚Äù according to a report by Fortune Magazine. A Spokesperson for the Department of Financial Services told Fortune:
The decision to take possession of the bank and hand it over to the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp (FDIC) was based on the current status of the bank and its ability to do business in a safe and sound manner on Monday
Regulators Targeted Crypto Banks?
Despite‚Ä¶

entry.title: Billionaire ‚ÄòBond King‚Äô Jeffrey Gundlach Expects Fed to Raise Rates Next Week ‚Äî ‚ÄòThat Would Be the Last Increase‚Äô
entry.summary:
Billionaire Jeffrey Gundlach, aka the ‚ÄúBond King,‚Äù expects the Federal Reserve to raise interest rates at its March meeting next week, which ‚Äúwould be the last increase,‚Äù he said. In addition, Gundlach cautioned: ‚ÄúThe inflationary policy is back in play with the Federal Reserve.‚Äù
Doubleline CEO Jeffrey Gundlach on Fed Rate Hikes
Jeffrey Gundlach, chief executive and chief investment officer of investment management firm Doubleline, shared his Fed rate hike expectations in an interview with CNBC Monday. Gundlach is nicknamed ‚Äúthe Bond King‚Äù after he appeared on the cover of Barron‚Äôs as ‚ÄúThe New Bond King‚Äù in 2011. According to Forbes, his net worth is currently $2.2 billion.

entry.title: US Officials Attempting to Block Voyager Sale Again, Report Shows
entry.summary:
According to a recent Bloomberg report, U.S. regulators are again attempting to interfere with the sale of the bankrupt crypto lender Voyager Digital to major crypto trading platform Binance.US.¬†
Although U.S. Bankruptcy Judge Michael Wiles, overseeing Voyager‚Äôs Chapter 11 bankruptcy proceedings, has approved Binance.US‚Äôs acquisition of Voyager, the country‚Äôs regulators oppose the sale.¬†
According to the report, other elements of the deal could go through, but not the legal protections provided in Voyager‚Äôs Chapter 11 filing. In addition, U.S. Bankruptcy Judge Michael Wiles, has agreed to hold a hearing on Wednesday to decide whether to halt Voyager‚Äôs indemnification provisions.
Voyager Deal Blocked By Regulators?
Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) lawyers claim that parts ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Moody‚Äôs Downgrades US Banking Sector to Negative After Collapse of Three Major Banks
entry.summary:
After the failure of three major U.S. banks last week, with two of them being the second and third largest banking failures in the country, Moody‚Äôs Investors Service has downgraded the rating of the U.S. banking system from ‚Äústable‚Äù to ‚Äúnegative.‚Äù As one of the ‚ÄúBig Three‚Äù credit rating firms, Moody‚Äôs cited a ‚Äúrapid deterioration in the operating environment‚Äù following the collapse of these banks.
Moody‚Äôs Downgrades U.S. Banks, Financial Institutions Face Rising Deposit Costs and Reduced Earnings
Moody‚Äôs Investors Service, the American credit rating agency, has downgraded the U.S. banking sector from ‚Äústable‚Äù to ‚Äúnegative.‚Äù The agency cited the collapse of three banks within seven days in the United States last week. Silvergate Bank decided to voluntarily liquidate, and Silicon Valley ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Jump Above $25,000 Has Sent 2.7M More Coins Into Profits
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows around 2.7 million more coins have entered a state of profit following Bitcoin‚Äôs jump above the $25,000 level.
65% Of The Adjusted Bitcoin Supply Is Now In The Green
According to data from the on-chain analytics firm Glassnode, an additional 20% of the adjusted supply is now enjoying profits. The relevant indicator here is the ‚Äúpercent supply in profit.‚Äù As its name already implies, it measures the percentage of the total circulating Bitcoin supply currently holding unrealized gains.
The metric works by going through the on-chain history of each coin in the circulating supply to check what price it was last moved at. If this previous value for any coin was less than the latest Bitcoin price, then that coin is counted under the supply in profit.
There is a proble‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ethereum Deflation Hits Record High Six Months After Merge, What This Means For ETH
entry.summary:
Regardless of Ethereum‚Äôs odd price action over the past few days, the second-largest crypto by market cap has been breaking records behind the scenes. According to Ultrasoundmoney, ETH supply deflation has recently hit a record high as the total ETH supply has dropped by nearly 1% in the past 30 days.
This drop in supply comes at a time when the ETH price has dipped in recent weeks and is currently showing a bullish trend. Over the past three days, ETH has surged by nearly 10% after surviving major losses from last week.¬†
Deflation Ramps Up As Ethereum Supply Plummets
No doubt, Ethereum‚Äôs transition into a proof-of-stake consensus has been a blessing to the network. Not only has it impacted the asset‚Äôs supply positively, but it has also been beneficial to the network‚Äôs overall growth‚Ä¶

entry.title: The Latest Banking Crisis Is Why I Save In Bitcoin
entry.summary:
The collapse of Silicon Valley Bank has highlighted just how fragile the legacy financial system is.
This is an opinion editorial by Mickey Koss, a West Point graduate with a degree in economics. He spent four years in the infantry before transitioning to the Finance Corps. This was inevitable and it will continue being inevitable in one form or another, as long as the system exists as is. When the fix is more money printing, which doesn‚Äôt fix anything, the collapse will always be inevitable.¬†
Reflecting on the events from this weekend, I have a feeling that it is only the tip of the iceberg, setting the stage for what may come to be over the next few years; a slow motion train wreck of the financial and banking system, systemically-depende‚Ä¶

entry.title: DeFi Hack: Euler Finance Pushes to Recover Funds After Blocking Vulnerable Module
entry.summary:
Euler Finance, a lending protocol in the decentralized finance (DeFi) space, which has witnessed several losses of funds through network exploits, has fallen victim to the largest exploit so far in 2023.
Recently, the space Meta Sleuth, a crypto analytics company, recently reported the attacks on Euler Finance. The firm noted that the lending platform lost tokens worth over $190 million, which include 43.6M DAI and 96,800 ETH tokens.
Further, the DeFi lending platform attack affected some DeFi protocols, including Balancer. The exploit led to the loss of more than 65% of the Balancer‚Äôs TVL before its reaction in pausing the pool.
Euler Finance Blocks Vulnerable Module
According to a post on Euler Labs‚Äô official Twitter page, the protocol has taken some critical actions to fix th‚Ä¶

entry.title: Federal Investigators Probe Silicon Valley Bank Collapse; SVB and Top Execs Sued by Shareholders
entry.summary:
The parent company of Silicon Valley Bank, SVB Financial Group, and two senior executives have been sued by shareholders after SVB‚Äôs collapse last Friday. The proposed class action accuses SVB of hiding the fact that interest rate hikes would leave the bank in jeopardy. Additionally, anonymous sources say the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) and the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) are investigating the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank.
Report Says Investigations Into Silicon Valley Bank‚Äôs Collapse Include Stock Sales by Senior Executives

entry.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity
entry.summary: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.

entry.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'
entry.summary: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives‚Äîand his prediction that brands will drive that.

entry.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past
entry.summary: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.

entry.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'
entry.summary: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."

entry.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young
entry.summary: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.

entry.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs
entry.summary: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.

entry.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets
entry.summary: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.

entry.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'
entry.summary: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.

entry.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'
entry.summary: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX, the exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.

entry.title: Community Gaming CEO: Ethereum Smart Contracts Can Solve 'Pain Points' of Gamers Getting Paid
entry.summary: Chris Gonsalves, CEO of esports tournament platform Community Gaming, talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about Web3 gaming, his past stint at ConsenSys, and using smart contracts to get gamers paid instantly. Community Gaming has also just announced the 3XP Gaming Expo, June 8-9 in Pasadena, CA.

entry.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson coined the term ‚Äúmetaverse‚Äù in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel ‚ÄúSnow Crash.‚Äù Now he‚Äôs helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in ‚ÄúSnow Crash,‚Äù goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver
entry.summary: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.

entry.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'
entry.summary: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.

entry.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast
entry.summary: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.

entry.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace
entry.summary: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."

entry.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini
entry.summary: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."

entry.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'
entry.summary: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.

entry.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria
entry.summary: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."

entry.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next
entry.summary: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next‚Äîincluding token-gated sneaker drops.

entry.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs
entry.summary: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.
